result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Stephen Sawyer

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew Jason Papachronis
Current: 2256 Ransom Rd., Valparaiso, IN 46385 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2022)
Prior: 15119 Geist Ridge Dr, Fishers, IN 46040
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
matter set for ptc 10/24/22 at 9:00
Judge Michael D Zell assigned

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge filed by Atty Stephen Sawyer
filed by Atty Stephen Sawyer
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
No contact with R.N.P or W.D.M. their residence or place of employment
Cash bond posted on 07/27/22

Information to be filed to mirror the charges in the criminal complaint.
Atty Sawyer is willing to go forward. 
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Substitution of Judge had been filed by Atty Sawyer.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

2:08 PM Defendant Matthew Jason Papachronis in court.  Attorney Stephen W. Sawyer in court for Matthew Jason Papachronis.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Atty Sawyer filed a waiver of preliminary hearing form.  
Court will not address the waiver of preliminary hearing today do to the time constraints.
Atty Sawyer states that his client resides in Indiana. 
Information has not been filed yet by ADA Dodge states that they will file to reflect the charges as stated in the criminal complaint.  

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends that the $5,000 cash bond be reinstated to add conditions.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

22R 007149
Warrant Issued on July 26, 2022
Warrant Issued on July 14, 2022

2:09 PM Defendant Matthew Jason Papachronis not in court.  Attorney Stephen W. Sawyer in court for Matthew Jason Papachronis.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court goes back on the record in this case.
Court states that this was a warrant issue and court puts a brief statement as to what was heard earlier.
Court puts the bond issue/warrant issue on the record.
State has filed a new criminal warrant request.
Court will sign the new warrant.
Atty Sawyer makes statements with regards to mentioning the "conditions" that had been previously stated.
Conditions are not able to be put on a warrant.
Atty Sawyer states that he will strongly advise his client to not have any contact with the person(s) mentioned in the return on warrant/initial appearance hearing held earlier today.

BY THE COURT:
Court will quash earlier warrant 
New warrant will be signed by the Court

1:00 PM 
Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephen W. Sawyer in court for Matthew Jason Papachronis. Defendant does not appear.
Atty Sawyer calls the case.
Atty Sawyer makes statements regarding the defendant's non-appearance and requests that the court rescind the arrest warrant.
ADA Cassidy notes that the State would object to rescinding the warrant.
Court states appearances and makes statements regarding a letter in the court record.
Atty Sawyer makes further statements in favor of rescinding the warrant and provides some background on the matter.
Court questions Atty Sawyer regarding the defendant's non-appearance.
Atty Sawyer notes that the defendant is in custody in another state and has waived his right to an extradition hearing.
Court questions ADA Cassidy regarding her position in this matter.
ADA Cassidy responds and states that they object to rescinding the bond.

Court states findings.

BY THE COURT:
Arrest warrant is amended to allow for a $5000 cash alternative to be paid.
Warrant will remain outstanding until the cash alternative is paid.
No contact with R.M.P., in person, her place of residence, or by phone, internet, social media, or email.
No contact with the victim's boyfriend, W.D.M.

Initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
